news.title: Dehradun: Rispana bank residents await EWS flats amid demolition fears
news.para: Residents of Kathbangla colony face demolition fears as promised EWS flats remain undelivered by the Dehradun Municipal Corporation. Despite NGT-mandated notices for floodplain encroachment, over a month has passed without relocation, leaving families anxious about losing their homes in the cold.

news.title: Now, get survey certificate online through Visakhapatnam civic body site
news.para: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation (GVMC) has launched an online application system for survey certificates for buildings and vacant plots. This new digital platform allows citizens to apply, track, and obtain certificates within seven days, eliminating the need for manual visits to multiple offices.

news.title: Homebuyers in Tamil Nadu to get relief on stamp duty and registration fees
news.para: Tamil Nadu homebuyers registering first-sale apartments and villas will now benefit from a new government order. Stamp duty and registration fees paid on construction agreements before December 1, 2023, can be set off against the composite value of land and building during sale deed registration. This move aims to prevent double payment for buyers and aligns with RERA regulations.

news.title: IT department probes sub-registrar office in Agra over property transaction irregularities
news.para: Income tax officials conducted a review of property registration records at a sub-registrar office in Agra, investigating potential concealment of transactions exceeding Rs 10 lakh without PAN and Rs 30 lakh. Land deeds worth Rs 1,000 crore are under scrutiny, with action to follow for taxpayers found to have underreported or provided defective financial transaction statements.

news.title: Bengaluru: HC order ignored, illegal construction continues in HAL III Stage
news.para: Residents have taken their fight to the High Court after over 40 complaints about alleged building norm violations in HAL III Stage went unaddressed. Despite a court order for the BCCC to issue notices and stop non-compliant construction, residents claim work continues, nearing inauguration and causing significant disruption and safety concerns.

news.title: Ahmedabad: Demolition of 25 houses at Thaltej society begins
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation commenced demolishing 25 houses in Snehanjali Society, Thaltej, following prior demolition notices. Residents, after protesting a land dispute, have agreed to temporary relocation in Gujarat Housing Board flats in Naranpura. They've accepted the civic body's and housing board's decisions on rent and financial matters. Most homes have now been razed.

news.title: Punjab CIC pulls up Amritsar civic body over missing records of commercial complex
news.para: The Punjab Information Commissioner has directed an inquiry into Amritsar Municipal Corporation's failure to locate records for a prominent commercial complex. The Commissioner expressed serious concerns over record management and enforcement of building bye-laws, questioning the corporation's ability to retrieve building plans and ensure adequate parking facilities.

news.title: Post- auction, Aviom India Housing Finance promoter tables a full settlement plan
news.para: Aviom India Housing Finance promoter Kajal Ilmi has submitted a revised settlement offer of ₹554 crore upfront, aiming to repay lenders and withdraw bankruptcy proceedings. This comes after Unity Small Finance Bank emerged as the winning bidder in a challenge auction for the company. The proposal includes an equity infusion and aims to maximize value for stakeholders.

news.title: Chandigarh: HC raps HSVP for charging current rates for plots, grants relief to oustees
news.para: Land oustees have received a major relief from the Punjab and Haryana High Court. The court ruled that Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran cannot charge current market rates for residential plots. Beneficiaries will now pay rates prevalent at the time of application. The court found the authority's delay in issuing allotment letters arbitrary.

news.title: Gurugram: DTCP flags illegal subdivision at business complex, freezes sale deeds
news.para: Gurgaon's District Town Planner has taken action against Sewa Corporate Park for illegal subdivision and sale of units without a mandatory licence. The commercial complex, which received an occupation certificate in 2009, was later carved into multiple shops and offices without statutory approval.

news.title: Arjun Sharma of Select City Walk buys South Delhi property for ₹125 crore
news.para: Arjun Sharma, a co-founder of Select City Walk, has acquired a prime South Delhi bungalow for Rs 125 crore. The exclusive West End property, a rare offering, highlights the enduring demand for luxury real estate in the capital. This significant transaction underscores the robust activity among High-Net-Worth Individuals in the Delhi market.

news.title: Union cabinet clears three new metro stretches in Delhi, including Central Vista corridor
news.para: Delhi's infrastructure receives a significant upgrade with the Union Cabinet's approval for three new Metro corridors. A key stretch will connect RK Ashram Marg to Indraprastha, enhancing access to Kartavya Bhavans and India Gate. Two other corridors will improve airport and south Delhi connectivity.

news.title: NBCC starts its real estate operations in Dubai
news.para: NBCC India has begun overseas real estate operations in Dubai. A subsidiary has acquired land for a mixed-use development. The company also signed an MoU with Mumbai Port Authority. This partnership will focus on developing a CGO Complex on port land.

news.title: Beijing further eases home buying curbs
news.para: Beijing has taken a significant step to energize its real estate sector by easing home purchasing rules. Non-residents will now need just one year of income tax payments to qualify, instead of two. In an encouraging development for larger families, there’s an allowance to acquire an extra residence in the heart of the city.

news.title: Ludhiana civic body chief orders quick recovery, crackdown on illegal constructions
news.para: MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal has instructed building branch officials to speed up recovery of dues. He also ordered them to halt illegal constructions across Ludhiana. Officials must meet recovery targets or face departmental action. They must also certify that no illegal building is occurring in their areas. Residents are urged to get building plan approval before starting construction.

news.title: J Estates enters into senior living housing segment
news.para: J Estates is venturing into the senior living market, launching three major initiatives in Gurugram. Comprising approximately 450 units, these projects will embody luxury and comfort, with a total investment of ₹2,100 crore.

news.title: Japan's Sapporo Holdings to sell real estate business to KKR-PAG group for $3.1 billion
news.para: Sapporo Holdings is selling its real estate business to a consortium led by KKR and PAG. The deal is valued at 477 billion yen. This move follows pressure from activist investors. Sapporo will use the funds for growth and debt reduction. The real estate market in Japan is attracting investor interest.

news.title: Embassy REIT sells 3.76 lakh sq ft space in Manyata Park in Bengaluru for ₹530 crore
news.para: Embassy REIT has offloaded prime office space in Bengaluru for an impressive ₹530 crore. The acquisition by EAAA Alternatives' Rental Yield Plus fund strengthens their presence in the renowned Embassy Manyata Business Park.

news.title: Navi Mumbai International Airport set to commence operations on December 25
news.para: The Navi Mumbai International Airport is set to begin commercial flights on Thursday. This new airport will significantly cut travel times and boost tourism. It will also attract major investments to the region.

news.title: Issue clear norms, Karnataka-RERA chief tells government as OC–CC confusion continues
news.para: K-Rera chairman Rakesh Singh has urged the Karnataka government to issue clear guidelines on occupancy and completion certificates due to conflicting interpretations across various laws. This regulatory ambiguity is causing confusion and harming homebuyers in Bengaluru, with local bodies interpreting provisions differently, leading to delays and potential exploitation by developers.
